summary: I’ve remained pretty spoiler-free for Critical Role so far except for Molly. And I didn’t even read about it or hear anything...
body: I’ve remained pretty spoiler-free for Critical Role so far except for Molly. And I didn’t even read about it or hear anything about what happened to him I just one day saw a nice pic of Clay and went “Huh Taliesin has 2 PCs” and like a week later it hit me and I was like “OH.” And now I’m afraid of getting attached to him because I got real attached to Scanlan and we all know how that went down and I was a broken person after that.

And I didn’t even read about it or hear anything about what happened to him I just one day saw a nice pic of Clay and went “Huh Taliesin has 2 PCs” and like a week later it hit me and I was like “OH.” And now I’m afraid of getting attached to him because I got real attached to Scanlan and we all know how that went down and I was a broken person after that.

This blog mostly runs on queue so replies might take a while. (I follow as frostbann; personal/fandom blog is voidblessed)

summary: Critical Role things I love
body:
Critical Role things I love

Marisha squating in her chair when things get exciting

“Natural 20, motherfucker!”

Liam gesticulating when spellcasting

The douche sword

Anytime anyone says the same thing at the same time

When someone does something, Matt’s eyes go wide and he says “Okay…”

“Well, you can certainly try.”

Doors.

Travis putting the calm mask on after freaking out

Idiot’s Guide To Sailing

Feel free to reblog and add your own!

summary: After watching through the scene with the murals in episode 40, I caught a detail I missed the first time. Matt described each...
body: After watching through the scene with the murals in episode 40, I caught a detail I missed the first time. Matt described each mural containing a crowd of people along with the chosen ones and the monsters. The crowds on each mural were detailed enough to tell that the types of clothes they wore were all different, denoting different peoples. My guess is that this indicates the peoples of the Menagerie Coast, the Dwendalian Empire, and Xhorhas, seeing as those are the three major regions Matt has established for this campaign. So it’s likely that at least the temples of the three creatures are limited to these areas, if not the missing eyes themselves: Uk’otoa’s temples out on the sea and along the coast, the worm’s would probably be in Xhorhas (Yasha dreamt of the land crawling with worms), and the firebird would be left for the Empire.

reblog.comment: After watching through the scene with the murals in episode 40, I caught a detail I missed the first time. My guess is that this indicates the peoples of the Menagerie Coast, the Dwendalian Empire, and Xhorhas, seeing as those are the three major regions Matt has established for this campaign. So it’s likely that at least the temples of the three creatures are limited to these areas, if not the missing eyes themselves: Uk’otoa’s temples out on the sea and along the coast, the worm’s would probably be in Xhorhas (Yasha dreamt of the land crawling with worms), and the firebird would be left for the Empire.

My guess is that this indicates the peoples of the Menagerie Coast, the Dwendalian Empire, and Xhorhas, seeing as those are the three major regions Matt has established for this campaign. So it’s likely that at least the temples of the three creatures are limited to these areas, if not the missing eyes themselves: Uk’otoa’s temples out on the sea and along the coast, the worm’s would probably be in Xhorhas (Yasha dreamt of the land crawling with worms), and the firebird would be left for the Empire.

Matt described each mural containing a crowd of people along with the chosen ones and the monsters. The crowds on each mural were detailed enough to tell that the types of clothes they wore were all different, denoting different peoples. My guess is that this indicates the peoples of the Menagerie Coast, the Dwendalian Empire, and Xhorhas, seeing as those are the three major regions Matt has established for this campaign. So it’s likely that at least the temples of the three creatures are limited to these areas, if not the missing eyes themselves: Uk’otoa’s temples out on the sea and along the coast, the worm’s would probably be in Xhorhas (Yasha dreamt of the land crawling with worms), and the firebird would be left for the Empire.

summary:
Pike, picking people for aid: ... vex, ... and scanlan. 
Scanlan, the day after being told pike was confused about him but had...
body:
Pike, picking people for aid: … vex, … and scanlan.

Scanlan, the day after being told pike was confused about him but had feelings for someone else: don’t worry about me

Pike, with finality: scanlan

Scanlan: don’t waste spells on me. i’m fine.

Pike, staring down scanlan: and for death ward…

Scanlan: don’t… don’t worry about me if somebody else needs it more

Pike: death ward on scanlan 😊
